results.title: Metformin delays the decline in thermogenic function of brown adipose tissue in a mouse model of Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome.
results.text_hl: To mitigate the age-related decline in BAT thermogenic capacity, we treated @<m>DISEASE_Progeroid_syndrome_neonatal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536423 @@@progeroid@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ to investigate the potential mechanisms by which @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ can slow the reduction in BAT thermogenic function.

citations.NLM: Xiang X, Feng Y, Li H, Li W, Li J, Xia Z, Pang H, Wang Z. Metformin delays the decline in thermogenic function of brown adipose tissue in a mouse model of Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome. Exp Gerontol. 2025 Feb 6;201():112702. PMID: 39909311
citations.BibTeX: @article{39909311, title={Metformin delays the decline in thermogenic function of brown adipose tissue in a mouse model of Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome.}, author={Xiang X and Feng Y and Li H and Li W and Li J and Xia Z and Pang H and Wang Z}, journal={Exp Gerontol}, volume={201}, pages={112702}}

results.title: Reactivation of latently infected HIV-1 viral reservoirs and correction of aberrant alternative splicing in the LMNA gene via AMPK activation: Common mechanism of action linking HIV-1 latency and Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome.
results.text_hl: Moreover, similar epigenetic modifications and cell cycle regulators also characterize the analogous stages of premature senescence in @<m>DISEASE_Progeroid_syndrome_neonatal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536423 @@@progeroid@@@ cells and latency in @SPECIES_11676 @@@HIV-1@@@ @DISEASE_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infected@@@ T cells.

citations.NLM: Finley J. Reactivation of latently infected HIV-1 viral reservoirs and correction of aberrant alternative splicing in the LMNA gene via AMPK activation: Common mechanism of action linking HIV-1 latency and Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome.
